intro: Pseudocodon hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy pseudocodon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
